moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 b6 3. e3 Bb7
comment:
George and I have played many times. He usually
plays a Colle or Torre System of some kind so I play a line that has brought
me success against him in the past.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 b6 3. e3 Bb7 4. Nbd2 g6 5. Bd3 Bg7 6. O-O O-O 7. b3 d6
comment:
It is a matter of "taste" whether Blacks pawn goes to d6 or d5. I prefer d6
when the centre can be contested with either e5 or c5.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 b6 3. e3 Bb7 4. Nbd2 g6 5. Bd3 Bg7 6. O-O O-O 7. b3 d6 8. Bb2 Nbd7 9. c4 e5 10. Qc2 Re8
comment: Black has snatched a small initiative with the threat of 11...e4.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 b6 3. e3 Bb7 4. Nbd2 g6 5. Bd3 Bg7 6. O-O O-O 7. b3 d6 8. Bb2 Nbd7 9. c4 e5 10. Qc2 Re8 11. d5 Nc5
1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 b6 3. e3 Bb7 4. Nbd2 g6 5. Bd3 Bg7 6. O-O O-O 7. b3 d6 8. Bb2 Nbd7 9. c4 e5 10. Qc2 Re8 11. d5 Nc5 12. Be2
comment:
I felt 12.e4 was better. Black
is unlikely to exchange the c5 knight for a Bishop with little future.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 b6 3. e3 Bb7 4. Nbd2 g6 5. Bd3 Bg7 6. O-O O-O 7. b3 d6 8. Bb2 Nbd7 9. c4 e5 10. Qc2 Re8 11. d5 Nc5 12. Be2 Bc8
comment: The Bishop threatens to come to f5.

comment: White creates a new weakness at f4.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 b6 3. e3 Bb7 4. Nbd2 g6 5. Bd3 Bg7 6. O-O O-O 7. b3 d6 8. Bb2 Nbd7 9. c4 e5 10. Qc2 Re8 11. d5 Nc5 12. Be2 Bc8 13. e4 Nh5 14. b4 Nd7 15. Nb3 Nf4 16. Rfe1 Rf8 17. Rad1
comment:
#This is not the correct plan. White should continue with 17.Rac1 and
c5 or 17.a4 and a5.

comment: The exclamation mark is not for the move itself, but for the plan it initiates.
